content: In completion tools, we grew the total number of stages completed by approximately 38% year-over-year compared to U.S. EIA completions, which increased by approximately 22% over that same time period. Our cementing service line increased the total number of jobs completed by approximately 50% year-over-year, while also increasing our average price per job by approximately 34% year-over-year. In wireline, total stages completed increased by approximately 26% year-over-year, with the average price per stage increasing by approximately 18%. In January, we announced the redemption of our senior notes due 2023, which was partially funded with the net proceeds of our offering of 300,000 units, each comprised of $1,000 principal amount of 13% senior secured notes due 2028 and five shares of Nine's common stock. As of December 31, 2022, Nine's cash and cash equivalents were $17.4 million, with $66.6 million of availability under the revolving credit facility, resulting in a total liquidity position of $84 million as of December 31, 2022. On January 27, 2023, the company borrowed an additional $40 million under the revolving credit facility to pay for a portion of the redemption price of the 8.75% senior notes due 2023 and to pay for fees and expenses related to the units offering. Cementing revenue for the quarter was $65 million, an increase of approximately 2%. Wireline revenue for the quarter was $30.3 million, an increase of approximately 3%. Completion tool revenue was $35.3 million, a decrease of approximately 13%. Coiled tubing revenue for the quarter was $35.9 million, an increase of approximately 8%. The company recognized an income tax provision of approximately $0.5 million for the year, resulting in an effective tax rate of 3.7% for 2022.
